title: EU AI Act Scope Exclusions
description: Systems/activities/actors excluded from EU AI Act application despite satisfying scope pathways
logical_effect: If ANY exclusion applies, regulation does not apply (or applies only partially per Art 2(2))

exclusions.title: Limited application for certain product safety high-risk systems
exclusions.description: Special rule: NOT a full exclusion, but limited application
exclusions.applies_to: High-risk AI systems per Article 6(1) related to products covered by Union harmonisation legislation in Section B of Annex I

conditions.element: AI system classified as high-risk per Article 6(1)
conditions.note: Article 6(1): safety component + third-party conformity assessment pathway

conditions.element: Related to products covered by Union harmonisation legislation listed in Section B of Annex I
conditions.requires: Reading Annex I Section B to determine covered products

exclusions.legal_effect: ONLY following provisions apply: Article 6(1), Articles 102-109, Article 112. Article 57 applies only if high-risk requirements integrated into that harmonisation legislation.
exclusions.interpretation: These systems governed primarily by sectoral product safety law, not full AI Act regime
exclusions.note: NOT a full exclusion - creates parallel lighter regime
exclusions.critical_dependency: Must map Annex I Section B

exclusions.title: National security and military exclusion

sub_exclusions.description: Areas outside scope of Union law and Member State national security competences

conditions.element: Area outside scope of Union law
conditions.flag: LOW_CONFIDENCE: What constitutes 'areas outside scope of Union law'? Requires EU competence analysis.

conditions.element: OR affects Member State competences concerning national security
conditions.note: Regardless of type of entity entrusted by Member States

sub_exclusions.description: AI systems for exclusive military/defence/national security purposes

conditions.element: AI system
Placed on market, put into service, or used
With or without modification
EXCLUSIVELY for military, defence or national security purposes
conditions.emphasis: EXCLUSIVELY - dual use systems not excluded

sub_exclusions.irrespective_of: Type of entity carrying out activities

conditions.element: AI system NOT placed on market or put into service in Union
Output used in Union
EXCLUSIVELY for military, defence or national security purposes

sub_exclusions.irrespective_of: Type of entity carrying out activities

exclusions.critical_note: EXCLUSIVELY is key - partial military use does not trigger exclusion

exclusions.title: Third country public authorities in law enforcement cooperation
exclusions.description: Public authorities and international organisations in cooperative law enforcement/judicial frameworks

conditions.element: Public authority in third country OR international organisation
Falls within scope per Article 2(1)
Uses AI systems in framework of international cooperation or agreements
conditions.flag: LOW_CONFIDENCE: What constitutes 'framework of' such cooperation?

conditions.element: For law enforcement and judicial cooperation with Union or Member States
Third country or organisation provides adequate safeguards for fundamental rights and freedoms
conditions.flag: LOW_CONFIDENCE: 'adequate safeguards' - who determines? What standard?

exclusions.note: Diplomatic/cooperation carve-out with human rights conditionality

exclusions.title: Digital Services Act preservation
exclusions.description: Does not affect intermediary service provider liability rules
exclusions.legal_effect: Preserves DSA liability regime - not substantive exclusion but coordination provision
exclusions.note: Harmony clause, not exclusion per se

exclusions.title: Scientific research and development exclusion
exclusions.description: AI systems/models specifically developed for sole purpose of scientific R&D

conditions.element: AI systems or AI models, including their output
Specifically developed
Put into service
For the SOLE purpose of scientific research and development
conditions.flag: LOW_CONFIDENCE: What if research has commercial applications later? At what point does 'sole purpose' cease?

exclusions.critical_note: SOLE purpose - academic/research carve-out but narrow

exclusions.title: GDPR and data protection law relationship
exclusions.description: Not an exclusion - coordination and preservation of data protection law
exclusions.legal_effect: Union data protection law applies to personal data processed in connection with AI Act rights/obligations. AI Act does not affect GDPR, ePrivacy Directive, Law Enforcement Directive.
exclusions.exceptions: Without prejudice to Article 10(5) and Article 59

exclusions.title: Pre-market research, testing, development exclusion
exclusions.description: R&D activities BEFORE placing on market or putting into service

conditions.element: Research, testing or development activity
Regarding AI systems or AI models
PRIOR TO being placed on market or put into service
conditions.note: Temporal limitation - once on market/in service, exclusion ceases

exclusions.important_exception: Testing in real world conditions NOT covered by this exclusion
exclusions.reference_exception: Article 57, 60 - real-world testing has separate regime
exclusions.critical_note: Exception within exclusion - real-world testing IS regulated even pre-market

exclusions.title: Consumer protection and product safety harmony
exclusions.description: Without prejudice to other Union consumer protection and product safety rules
exclusions.legal_effect: Not an exclusion - other rules continue to apply

exclusions.title: Personal non-professional use by natural persons
exclusions.description: Deployer obligations do not apply to natural persons in personal context

conditions.element: Obligations of deployers
conditions.note: Only deployer obligations excluded, not provider obligations

conditions.element: Deployer is natural person
Using AI systems
In course of purely personal non-professional activity
conditions.flag: LOW_CONFIDENCE: 'purely personal non-professional' - what about hobbyist activities? Side projects? Boundary with professional unclear.

exclusions.scope_of_exclusion: Deployer obligations only - does NOT exclude provider obligations or prohibited systems
exclusions.critical_note: Narrow exclusion - individual deployers only, not providers

exclusions.title: More favorable worker protection preservation
exclusions.description: Does not preclude more worker-favorable laws
exclusions.legal_effect: Minimum harmonization for worker rights - Member States can exceed
exclusions.note: Not an exclusion - floor not ceiling for worker rights

exclusions.title: Free and open-source software (FOSS) exclusion
exclusions.description: FOSS AI systems excluded UNLESS high-risk or prohibited/transparency-obligated

conditions.element: AI systems released under free and open-source licences
conditions.flag: LOW_CONFIDENCE: What qualifies as 'free and open-source licence'? OSI-approved? Specific terms?
conditions.note: No definition of FOSS in the Act

conditions.element: NOT placed on market or put into service as high-risk AI systems
NOT system falling under Article 5 (prohibited)
NOT system falling under Article 50 (transparency obligations)

exclusions.legal_effect: FOSS generally exempt UNLESS high-risk, prohibited, or transparency-obligated
exclusions.critical_note: Three exceptions substantially narrow this exclusion
exclusions.question: Does 'placed on market' apply to FOSS? Typical FOSS distribution model is 'making available' without commercial activity - need to check Art 3(9) definition

partial_exclusions: Article 6(1) high-risk in Section B Annex I products (limited provisions apply)

metadata.used_by: All provisions - must check exclusions before applying any obligation
metadata.confidence_overall: HIGH with specific interpretative elements requiring case-by-case evaluation
